pages.title: Early-Stage Investment Framework: From Thesis to Decision
pages.summary:
Early-Stage Investment Framework: From Thesis to Decision Bottom Line: Early-stage investing requires systematic evaluation across four key dimensions: Market Context, Sectoral Advantage, Business Model Viability, and Founding Team Execution. This framework has guided $50M+ in successful capital deployment across fintech, consumer tech, and frontier technology ventures.
Framework Overview Early-stage investment decisions can appear top-down or bottom-up but ultimately require validation through rigorous Product-Market-Fit analysis. This framework deconstructs the investment narrative into actionable evaluation criteria.
